title: Informed Search Algorithms
subject: Artificial Intelligence
theory:
Using domain knowledge (Heuristic) to find goal faster. 
- **Greedy**: Expand node closest to goal (h(n)). Fast but not optimal (can get stuck).
- **A* (A-Star)**: Expands node with lowest f(n) = g(n) + h(n). 
  g(n) = cost so far. h(n) = est cost to go.

examples.code: A* guarantees shortest path if h(n) is admissible.

real_world_use_cases.description: Units moving around obstacles use A*.
